item.title: A New Day(sheets) Dawns
item.description: day sheet \ ˈdā-ˌshēt \ noun : a concise snapshot of the day ahead that is shared with the touring party.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Token

item.title: Serverless Swift
item.description: It’s Swift on Server, minus the server. Deployed on AWS via Swift Cloud.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Token

item.title: CatchUp v3
item.description: I first launched CatchUp - Keep in Touch for iOS in May 2018. It was the first app I’d ever released and it was, from a code perspective, objectively pretty bad.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Token

item.title: Hot Local Food for iOS
item.description: Think Tinder, but for food, and it already likes you back. Say hello to Hot Local Food. Free, hot, and available on iOS 15 and newer.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Token

item.title: Nuxt 3 vs SvelteKit
item.description: I’ve been thinking for several months about rebuilding my website (again). There were several reasons. First, to dig back into front-end work and re-familiarize myself with that world. Next, to get up to speed with the latest JavaScript framework options and how they worked. And finally, my previous website was no longer cutting it for me in several different ways.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Token

item.title: Dynamic Lambda Storage
item.description: I published an article on Storyboard’s Dev Blog about how to configure dynamic amounts of ephemeral storage for a Lambda function on a per-invocation basis.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Token

item.title: One Year at Storyboard
item.description: This week marks one year since I joined Storyboard.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Token

item.title: Introducing Outrank
item.description: Today I’m excited to debut my first new iOS app in three years:
item.dc:creator: Ryan Token

item.title: I'm Joining Storyboard!
item.description: Hello out there! Relatively quick life update here – I’m joining a new company!
item.dc:creator: Ryan Token

item.title: Learning WebRTC
item.description: WebRTC can be tricky to wrap your mind around – there’s a lot involved and it’s easy to get overwhelmed. Once you understand the basics though, it’s much easier to reason about the rest.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Token

item.title: Rocking with the Jamstack
item.description: There comes a time in every young developer’s life when they stumble upon a technology, or a philosophy around technologies, that just works for them. At least, that’s what I envision an older and more experienced developer telling me.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Token

item.title: Catching Up
item.description: CatchUp - Keep in Touch was first released on May 6, 2018. It was the first iOS app I’d ever published to the App Store. Almost exactly two years later, I’m publishing this blog post and releasing an all-new, completely rewritten version of CatchUp.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Token

item.title: Rebuilding My Website
item.description: The summer of 2015 was the summer between my sophomore and junior years at the University of Tulsa. I had taken a few programming classes by that point, and was drawn to web development. To prove to myself that I knew my way around the basics, I wanted to build a personal website – I didn’t have a plan for it, but I knew that I wanted it.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Token
